title: (x) Hella Jongerius book vintage looking sans - Monotype Grotesque {Stephen}
content:
I have a better spread that I can post if this doesn’t help.

I’m pretty sure it’s not Knockout, Akkurat, Univers, Helvetica, Akzidens, Nobel, Gotham, Interstate, etc.

What do you think? I have a spread where the capitals look a lot like Nobel/Gotham. Again, I can post that too.

Thanks,

Sam

| --- | --- |
| [Hella Jongerius.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20081205093909/http:/typophile.com/files/Hella%20Jongerius.jpg) | 67.85 KB |

 [‹ (x) Condensed grot caps on 70s Brazilian album - Informal Gothic {Jazzy B}](http://web.archive.org/web/20081205093909/http:/www.typophile.com/node/42716 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) MP Patriot school logo - Wolf's Bane {Angel} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081205093909/http:/www.typophile.com/node/42749 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Sam Serif

comments.content: Now that you mention it, the type looks a lot like a font I currently have: Grotesque MT Std by Adobe. Is this the same design? Thanks again.

MT stands for Monotype, so yes, it would just be Adobe’s version of the same typeface.

- Lex
Yes, it’s a Monotype font, licensed to Adobe for retail sale.
Note that Monotype has not licensed their new opentype versions of the fonts to Adobe so if you want any of that you need to go to the source.
... or the source of my original link.
Yes, of course that works too. ;^)
